citations.narrative:
Licenses are issued for approved sites. The facility's website states that the facility has moved to a new address a few
miles from the old site address. The facility's facebook pages show posts on both 3/13/23 and 3/20/23 that the facility is
'moving this week'. During the previous two inspections the licensee and facility representative were told that if the facility
were to move the animals that USDA needed to be notified in writing of the new site address so the new site could be
approved for regulated activity. Another inspector reminded the licensee via a phone call on 3/17/23 that she needed to
submit the new address. Review of the Animal Care electronic database shows no notice that a new site address was
submitted to USDA Animal Care. A facility must notify Animal Care of new sites in order to have the new site approved for
regulated activity and ensure that the new site meets all Animal Welfare Act regulations and standards. Correct by
notifying USDA Animal Care of the new site address.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:30 am to 12:45
pm on 28 Mar. 2023.
The facility site address has a closed sign on the door and states that they are open by appointment only as they are
moving. Animals were observed inside the facility via the windows which give a view into a portion of the facility.
The facility website gives a second new address for the facility several miles away. A visit to this address was made.
There was a closed gate to the property.
Attempts were made to reach the licensee via two phone numbers (voicemail messages left), text and email. No response
was received by 1:30pm.
End Section

narrative:
2.1(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Requirements and application 
Licenses are issued for approved sites. The facility's website states that the facility has moved to a new address a few 
miles from the old site address. The facility's facebook pages show posts on both 3/13/23 and 3/20/23 that the facility is 
'moving this week'. During the previous two inspections the licensee and facility representative were told that if the facility 
were to move the animals that USDA needed to be notified in writing of the new site address so the new site could be 
approved for regulated activity. Another inspector reminded the licensee via a phone call on 3/17/23 that she needed to 
submit the new address. Review of the Animal Care electronic database shows no notice that a new site address was 
submitted to USDA Animal Care. A facility must notify Animal Care of new sites in order to have the new site approved for 
regulated activity and ensure that the new site meets all Animal Welfare Act regulations and standards. Correct by 
notifying USDA Animal Care of the new site address. 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:30 am to 12:45 
pm on 28 Mar. 2023.  
The facility site address has a closed sign on the door and states that they are open by appointment only as they are

moving. Animals were observed inside the facility via the windows which give a view into a portion of the facility.  
The facility website gives a second new address for the facility several miles away. A visit to this address was made. 
There was a closed gate to the property.  
Attempts were made to reach the licensee via two phone numbers (voicemail messages left), text and email. No response 
was received by 1:30pm. 
 
 
 
End Section
